topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack 1.1: Working with Virtual Environment(s)

body.p: The Virtual Environment (ESX) option allows you to configure, manage and control multiple virtual instances. You can configure your ESX hypervisor by either using the Horizon dashboard in the undercloud or EON client. This page describes the different tasks that you can perform using the ESX option in the undercloud.

section.title: Manage virtual environment
section.p: The virtual environment allows you to register and unregister vCenter and import clusters in the ESX vCenter environments. It also allows you to secure your vCenter by providing the SSL certificate while registering your vCenter.

section.title: Register vCenter
section.p: You can register vCenter by using the Horizon dashboard in the undercloud.

vCenter provides centralized management of virtual host and virtual machines from a single console. You can register only three vCenters in the compute service, although a single administrator can manage multiple workloads.
To register vCenter, perform the following steps:

li.p: In the Horizon undercloud dashboard, click the Resource Tab. The tab displays with options in the left panel.
Click Compute and then select ESX to open Manage Virtual Environments page.
Click Register vCenter displayed at the top right corner of the page. The Register vCenter dialog box is displayed.
Enter the following information:

ul.li: In the Name box, enter a name for the vCenter server connection.
In the IP Address box, enter the IP address of the vCenter server.
In the Username box, enter an account name that has administrative permissions.
In the Password box, enter the password.

In the Port box, enter the vCenter server port value.
Click Done. A message is displayed after the successful registration of vCenter.
After successful registration the vCenter server is displayed in the ESX vCenter table on the Manage Virtual Environments page

section.title: Compute Proxy Information
section.p: To configure the compute proxy information, follow these steps:

ol.li: Click the vCenter server connection name on the Manage Virtual Environment page.
On the vCenter details page, On the top right corner of the page click Configure Compute Proxy. The Configure Compute proxy dialog box is displayed.

In the Configure Compute proxy dialog box, enter the following information:
In the Datacenter drop down box, select the vCenter datacenter where you want to deploy the proxy.
In the Port group box, enter the management port group.
In the Hostname box, enter the hostname of the compute proxy.
DHCP includes two options: True and False:
If you want automatic IP address assignment for the proxy appliance, select True.
If you want to provide a static IP address for the appliance, select False, and then enter the following information:
In the IP address box, enter the compute proxy IP address.
In the Netmask box, enter the network mask.
In Gateway box, enter the network gateway IP address.
Click Done. A message is displayed when the update is successful.The above information can be modified when no cluster exists in an activate state.

section.title: View Registered ESX vCenters
section.p: To view the list of registered ESX vCenter, do the following:

li.p: In the Horizon undercloud dashboard, click the Resource Tab. The tab displays with options in the left panel.
Click the Resource Tab in the left panel. The tab displays an option in the left panel.
Click Compute and then select ESX to open Manage Virtual Environments page. The following information is displayed:

ul.li: Name: name of the vCenter.
IP Address: IP Address of the registered vCenter.
Actions: tasks you can perform on the ESX vCenter.

section.p: All the registered vCenter will be listed in the Manage Virtual Environment page.

section.title: Edit vCenter
section.p: When there is any change in the vCenter details you can use the edit option to capture the modification made in the vCenter details in the HPE Helion Horizon undercloud dashboard.
To edit the vCenter, do the following:

li.p: In the Horizon undercloud dashboard, click the Resource Tab in the left panel. The tab displays an option in the left panel.
Click Compute and then select ESX to open Manage Virtual Environments page.
Click Edit against the name of the ESX vCenter to modify the vCenter details. Edit vCenter dialog box is displayed.
Make the required the changes.
Click Done to save the changes.

section.title: Unregistering vCenters
section.p: With a help of single command you can unregister vCenter.

li.p: Unregister a Single vCenter
Unregister Multiple vCenters

section.p: To unregister a single vCenter, do the following:

li.p: In the Horizon undercloud dashboard, click the Resource Tab in the left panel. The tab displays an option in the left panel.
Click Compute and then select ESX to open Manage Virtual Environments page.
Click More drop-down list against the vCenter and select unregister vCenter. Confirm Unregister vCenter dialog box is displayed.
Click Unregister vCenter to unregister the selected vCenter, else click Cancel.

section.title: Import Cluster
section.p: You can import a cluster from Manage Virtual Environments page or vCenter Details. The Manage Virtual Environments page displays the information related to the registered vCenter. The vCenter Details page displays details: the name of the cluster, the data center, CPU usage, memory usage, disk usage, and action.
To import a cluster from Manage Virtual Environments page, do the following:

li.p: In the Horizon undercloud dashboard, click the Resource Tab in the left panel. The tab displays an option in the left panel.
Click Compute and then select ESX to open Manage Virtual Environments page.
Click More drop-down list against the vCenter and select Import Clusters. Import Cluster dialog box is displayed. In the Import Cluster dialog box, do the following:

ul.li: In the vCenter Name Server, the name of selected vCenter appears.
Click Data Center drop-down list and select the data center.
Click Cluster drop-down list and select the cluster.

li.p: Click Done. A message is displayed when the cluster is imported successful.

section.p: To import a cluster from the vCenter Details page, do the following:

li.p: In the Horizon undercloud dashboard, click the Resource Tab in the left panel. The tab displays an option in the left panel.
Click Compute and then select ESX to open Manage Virtual Environments page.
Select Name check box of the vCenter. vCenter Details (name of selected vCenter) page is displayed.
Click Import Clusters displayed on the top right corner of the page.An Import dialog box is displayed. In the Import Cluster dialog box, do the following:

ul.li: In the vCenter Name Server, the name of selected vCenter appears.
Click Data Center drop-down list and select the data center.
Click Cluster drop-down list and select the cluster.

li.p: Click Done. A message is displayed when the cluster is imported successful.

section.title: View Cluster Details
section.p: To view the details of the registered ESX vCenter, do the following:

li.p: In the Horizon undercloud dashboard, click the Resource Tab in the left panel. The tab displays an option in the left panel.
Click Compute and then select ESX to open Manage Virtual Environments page.
Select Name check box of the vCenter. vCenter Details (name of selected vCenter) page is displayed. The page displays the following information:

ul.li: Name: name of the cluster
Datacenter: datacenter of the cluster
CPU Usage: the usage of the CPU by a cumulative cluster of a particular vCenter.
Memory Usage: the usage of the memory by a cumulative cluster of a particular vCenter.
Disk Usage: usage of the disk by a cumulative cluster of a particular vCenter.
Action: task you can perform, that is, unimport the cluster.

section.title: Unimporting Clusters
section.p: You can unimport multiple clusters or a single cluster with a single command.

li.p: Unimport a single cluster
Unimport multiple clusters

section.p: To unimport one cluster, do the following:

li.p: In the Horizon undercloud dashboard, click the Resource Tab in the left panel. The tab displays an option in the left panel.
Click Compute and then select ESX to open Manage Virtual Environments page.
Select Name check box against the name of the vCenter. vCenter Details (name of selected vCenter) page is displayed.
Select the Name check box against the name of the clusters to unimport cluster.
Click Unimport Clusters against the name of the cluster in the Action cloumn.

section.p: To unimport multiple clusters with a single command, do the following:

li.p: In the Horizon undercloud dashboard, click the Resource Tab in the left panel. The tab displays an option in the left panel.
Click Compute and then select ESX to open Manage Virtual Environments page.
Select Name check box of the vCenter. vCenter Details (name of selected vCenter) page is displayed.
Select the Name check box against the name of the clusters to unimport cluster. You can select multiple clusters. Unimport Clusters get enabled on the top right corner of the page.
Click Unimport Clusters on the top right corner of the page to unimport the selected clusters.
